duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain tax records and prepares tax returns, related schedules, and related reports for Federal and multi-state and local Motor Vehicle Fuel tax jurisdictions.
Gather and analyze reports from ERP system (PDI) and other various databases on a calendar period basis.
Utilize Avalara software for EDI reporting to various jurisdictions.
Research and resolve Federal, State and Local tax notices on a timely basis.
Reconcile tax discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information.
Reconcile Motor Vehicle Fuel tax accounts to general ledger on a fiscal period basis.
Maintain accounting controls by following SOX procedures; maintains financial security by following internal controls.
Answer Motor Vehicle Fuel tax questions by researching and interpreting state and local tax regulations.
Reconcile General Ledger accounts and mitigate related variances.
Manage fuel tax audits and requests for documentation.
Assist other fuel team members as necessary.
Assist sales, price book and property tax team members as necessary.

Ensure compliance with requirements, policies and regulations by enforcing adherence to corporate systems, policies and governmental regulations; rendering opinions and advising management on needed actions.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reading professional publications; establishing personal networks; or participating in professional societies.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field preferred. Other combinations of experience and education to meet the minimum requirements may be substituted.
